result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

defendant.name: Harris, Willie James

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Willie James Harris in court.  Attorney Kerri Terann Cleghorn in court for Willie James Harris.  Prosecuting attorney Jacob A. Maule in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense is requesting final pretrial and jury trial dates. Case is adjourned to 11-11-22 at 1:30 pm for final pretrial and 11-16-22 at 8:30 am for jury trial.
Final pre-trial scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Jury trial scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Willie James Harris
Current: 2758 N 33rd Street, APT 227 - Box 38, Milwaukee, WI 53210 United States  (Effective: 09-19-2022)
Prior: 2758 N 33rd Street, APT 227 - Box 38, Milwaukee, WI 53210 United States

ADDRESS INFO for Willie James Harris
Current: 2758 N 33rd Street, APT 227 - Box 38, Milwaukee, WI 53210 United States  (Effective: 07-15-2022)
Prior: 3176 North 34th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53216
Letter from defendant re:  address & phone number change.  (WIllie J. Harris, 2758 N 33rd St - APT 227 - Box 38, Milwaukee WI 53210).
Order Appointing Counsel, signed and filed.

Defendant Willie James Harris in court.  Prosecuting attorney Michelle A. Grasso in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court conducted Indigency Hearing. Court held colloquy with defendant. Court found defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel by court. Defendant requested court appointed counsel and agreed to reimburse Milwaukee County for the expense. The court appointed Atty. Keri Cleghorn, present in court, to represent defendant in this matter at County expense and at the rate of $100.00 per hour. The court ordered the defendant repay the County at a rate of $25.00 per month beginning at the completion of the case, and then the 1st of each month there after. Court advised defendant failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 
Case is adjourned to 10-13-22 at 8:30 am for status conference.
Status conference scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY. 
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. 
Court orders  bail to be returned to the person who posted.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with LJP.
Court advised Defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Willie James Harris in court.  Prosecuting attorney Foley J. Van Lieshout Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office. Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible.  
The case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Br. 10.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 8/30/22 @ 1p
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 8-30-2022 @1p
